summary: This is a chain of forwarded emails from December 2018, containing earlier emails from 2016 discussing Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, a defamation case against Ghislaine Maxwell, and legal documents including a redacted FBI 302. The emails involve legal coordination and sharing of case information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of news report about his continued relationships with young women and his East Side mansion housing Russian playmates.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a defamation case; her motion to dismiss was denied by Judge Sweet.

persons.name: Judge Sweet
persons.context: Denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in the defamation case.

connections.description: Maxwell is a defendant in a defamation case related to Epstein; the email discusses legal matters involving both.

events.title: Page Six Report on Epstein
events.description: Page Six reported on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women and his East Side mansion housing Russian playmates.

events.title: Meeting and Document Sharing
events.description: A meeting occurred, followed by an email attaching legal documents including a complaint against Maxwell, declarations, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted FBI 302.

events.title: Maxwell's Motion to Dismiss Denied
events.description: Judge Sweet denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in the defamation case against her.

keyFacts: A 2016 Page Six report indicated Jeffrey Epstein continued relationships with young women and his East Side mansion housed Russian playmates.
In February 2016, Judge Sweet denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case against her.
Legal documents, including a redacted FBI 302, were shared via email among attorneys for case coordination.
The email chain shows ongoing legal activity and information sharing related to Epstein and Maxwell cases in 2016 and 2018.
